text: Prichard residents face 49x more sewage pollution than neighbors
Our leaders (Prichard govt, State govt, Federal govt, court appointed receiver) haven't done their duty to protect the people of Prichard from pollution
Prichard has a plan to repair the system and needs $400 million over 20 years to fix the problem
ADEM keeps telling the public that “federal rules” prevent Alabama from giving Prichard support from the State Revolving Fund, but federal law does not say that
Federal drinking water law gives Alabama permission to help struggling systems like Prichard as long as the funds are tied to a real fix and better management
If EPA clearly confirms this, it will show that helping or not helping Prichard is a choice Alabama is making, not something Washington is forcing
Prichard deserves the same access to state and federal water funds that other communities receive
ADEM has money, has the authority to do more than they're doing, and failure to act harms not only the citizens of prichard but the entire Coastal Alabama area.
